provenance.name: Robert N. Essick
provenance.dealer: Donald Heald acting for Essick at a Christie's auction
provenance.note: Possibly the impression sold from the collection of W. E. Moss, Sotheby's, 2 March 1937, in lot 139, with "Morning Amusement" (possibly Essick impression 2F) and impressions of both prints in colors (£8 to the dealer Dulau and Co.); possibly the impressions offered by Dulau, April 1937 catalogue, item 20 (£14), and 1940 catalogue 281, item 9 (£10.10s.), both times with the other prints in lot 139 in the Christie's auction; acquired by the dealer Charles Sessler from the dealer Stevens and Brown, with "Morning Amusement" (Essick impression 2F) for $13.33 in June 1949; sold by Sessler to Charles J. Rosenbloom, Oct. 1949, for $750 the pair; inherited by Rosenbloom's wife, Lucile Johnson Rosenbloom, in 1973; sold Christie's, 2 Nov. 1982, lot 35, with "Morning Amusement," Essick impression 2F (£918 to Donald Heald acting for Robert N. Essick).

illustration.illusobjdesc: At least five gowned figures stand near the edge of a grassy landmass in the lower right corner of the composition. The leftmost figure appears to be male as he has short curly hair and some sort of facial hair, perhaps a mustache or beard. He stands facing right to embrace the waist of the female figure at right. His right arm is raised at 45 degrees and rests on his companion's lower back; his left hand is visible just below his right, suggesting his left arm is wrapped around her body from the left. He appears to touch the female figure's exposed thigh with his extended left pinky figure. Like the other figures, he turns his head to look to the left. The female figure that the leftmost figure embraces stands second from the left and faces left. She has long hair, and her wide eyes and potentially open mouth suggest fear. She wears a gown with a high slit, exposing most of her left leg. Her left arm is at her side but bent upward sharply with left hand raised, palm facing out. Just above the female figure's head, slightly to the right, another head of curly hair is visible, suggesting there may be another figure standing immediately behind her. The third figure from the left is an old male figure with long hair and a long beard who stands facing forward but turns to look left. Both arms are bent just beyond 90 degrees and crossed in front of his chest where he makes fists with both hands. The figure leans or bends forward slightly. He is embraced from behind by another male(?) figure with short curly hair who stands facing forward and left. This figure bends his left arm at a right angle and wraps it around the waist of the older male figure. One of his legs may be extended behind him at right. To the right of this figure, the fifth clear figure in the group stands far right. This male(?) figure has short curly hair and faces forward with wide eyes and an open mouth. The figure may carry an indistinguishable object in front of his chest. A circular form to the right of this figure's head may suggest another figure standing behind him at right. Shadowy or cloudy darkness broken only by a lighter diagonal line or bolt in the upper left corner encompasses the remainder of the composition.

component.illusobjdesc: At least five gowned figures stand near the edge of a grassy landmass in the lower right corner of the composition. The leftmost figure appears to be male as he has short curly hair and some sort of facial hair, perhaps a mustache or beard. He stands facing right to embrace the waist of the female figure at right. His right arm is raised at 45 degrees and rests on his companion's lower back; his left hand is visible just below his right, suggesting his left arm is wrapped around her body from the left. He appears to touch the female figure's exposed thigh with his extended left pinky figure. He turns his head to look to the left.
Just above the head of the female figure second from the left, another head of curly hair is visible, suggesting there may be another figure standing immediately behind her.

At least five gowned figures stand near the edge of a grassy landmass in the lower right corner of the composition. The female figure that the leftmost figure embraces stands second from the left and faces left. She has long hair, and her wide eyes and potentially open mouth suggest fear. She wears a gown with a high slit, exposing most of her left leg. Her left arm is at her side but bent upward sharply with left hand raised, palm facing out

At least five gowned figures stand near the edge of a grassy landmass in the lower right corner of the composition. The third figure from the left is an old male figure with long hair and a long beard who stands facing forward but turns to look left. Unlike the other figures, the pupil of his depicted left eye is not visible, suggesting it may be a socket. Both arms are bent just beyond 90 degrees and crossed in front of his chest where he makes fists with both hands. The figure leans or bends forward slightly. He is embraced from behind by another male(?) figure.

At least five gowned figures stand near the edge of a grassy landmass in the lower right corner of the composition. The fourth figure from the left is a male(?) figure with short curly hair who stands facing forward and left and embraces the old male figure in front of him. This figure bends his left arm, which is by his side, at a right angle and wraps it around the waist of the older male figure. One of his legs may be extended behind him at right.

At least five gowned figures stand near the edge of a grassy landmass in the lower right corner of the composition. The rightmost distinguishable figure, and the fifth in the group, stands facing forward and slightly left. This male(?) figure has short curly hair, wide eyes, and an open mouth. The figure may carry an indistinguishable object in front of his chest. A circular form to the right of this figure's head may suggest another figure standing behind him at right.
At least five figures stand on what appears to be a grassy landmass or section of earth in the lower right corner of the composition.
At least five figures stand on what appears to be a landmass or section of earth covered with grass in the lower right corner of the composition.
Shadowy or cloudy darkness broken only by a lighter diagonal line or bolt in the upper left corner encompasses all but the lower right corner of the composition.
